alert.note: Alert for Clay (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:14PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Clay County through 600 PM CDT... At 513 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Terral, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Henrietta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
